**Demographics**

You were born in the year 2000, in country 716, where your mother was also born. Your father was born in the same country. You are currently 20 years old and belong to the unskilled worker group, working or having worked for a private business or industry. Your family just got by during the past year, and you or your family often went without a cash income in the last 12 months. You have completed primary education, and your mother has no formal education or only early childhood education.

**Family and Relationships**

Family is very important in your life, and you trust your family completely. You are currently single, and you do not feel close at all to your continent, county, region, or district. You do not feel very close to your village, town, or city, and you do not feel very secure these days. You have a great deal of confidence in the churches, but you do not have very much confidence in the government, parliament, banks, major companies, or universities.

**Health and Well-being**

You would describe your state of health these days as fair. You or your family rarely felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months, and you or your family rarely went without a safe shelter in the last 12 months. You or your family sometimes went without needed medicine or medical treatment in the last 12 months. You do not have very much confidence in the World Health Organization, but you have quite a lot of confidence in the armed forces.

**Work and Education**

Work is very important in your life, and you strongly agree that work should always come first, even if it means less spare time. You believe that economic growth and creating jobs should be the top priority, even if the environment suffers to some extent. You are unemployed, and you do not consider feeling of responsibility an important quality for children to learn. You do not consider imagination an important quality for children to learn, and you do not consider independence an important quality for children to learn.

**Politics and Governance**

Politics is very important in your life, but you are not very interested in politics. You do not feel close at all to your country, and you do not feel very close to the world. You believe that people obeying their rulers is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy, and you believe that women having the same rights as men is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy. You believe that people choosing their leaders in free elections is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy. You believe that living in a country that is governed democratically is absolutely important to you.

**Social and Moral Values**

You believe that violence against other people is never justified, and you believe that terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious mean is never justified. You believe that a man beating his wife is never justified, and you believe that a woman beating her husband is never justified. You believe that sex before marriage is never justified, and you believe that having casual sex is never justified. You believe that prostitution is never justified, and you believe that abortion is never justified. You believe that suicide is never justified, and you believe that the death penalty is never justified.

**Social and Economic Issues**

You belong to the lowest income group in your country, and you are a member of a labor union, but not active. You believe that people receiving state aid for unemployment is very essential as a characteristic of democracy, and you believe that civil rights protecting people from state oppression is very essential as a characteristic of democracy. You believe that governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor is not an essential characteristic of democracy, and you believe that the state making people's incomes equal is not an essential characteristic of democracy.

**Religion and Spirituality**

You believe in God, and you believe in heaven. You believe in hell, and you believe that God is very important in your life. You pray several times a day, and you attend religious services once a week. You believe that the basic meaning of religion is to follow religious norms and ceremonies instead of to do good to other people, and you believe that the basic meaning of religion is to make sense of life in this world instead of to make sense of life after death.

**Social Interactions and Trust**

You do not trust people you meet for the first time at all, and you do not trust people of another nationality very much. You do not trust people you know very much, and you do not have very much confidence in television, radio news, or the Internet. You do not have very much confidence in the police, but you have quite a lot of confidence in the churches. You do not mind having people of a different race, language, or religion as neighbors, but you would not like to have heavy drinkers as neighbors.

**Leisure and Hobbies**

Leisure time is rather important in your life, but you strongly agree that work should always come first, even if it means less spare time. You do not have very much confidence in universities, and you do not consider yourself a member of any art, music, or educational organization. You do not consider yourself a member of any sport or recreational organization, and you do not consider yourself a member of any environmental organization.
